unnormalised: ## Beyond Bollywood: Diving into the World of Film Festivals
normalised: hash Beyond Bollywood: Diving into the World of Film Festivals

unnormalised: Hey everyone! Ever been to a film festival? If your only experience with Indian cinema is limited to the latest Bollywood blockbuster playing at your local multiplex, you're missing out on a whole world of cinematic gems. Film festivals are so much more than just red carpets and celebrity spotting (though, let's be honest, that's a fun part too!).

Film festivals are so much more than just red carpets and celebrity spotting (though, let's be honest, that's a fun part too!).

unnormalised: Think of them as curated journeys into different cultures, perspectives, and storytelling styles. They're a place to discover independent films, documentaries that will blow your mind, and short films from emerging filmmakers. You might even stumble upon the next Anurag Kashyap!

unnormalised: In India, we have some fantastic film festivals. The International Film Festival of India (IFFI) in Goa is a big one, held every year, showcasing films from all over the globe. It's a total vibe with screenings, masterclasses, and networking opportunities galore. Then there's the Mumbai Film Festival, a huge event that attracts international stars. They show a great range of films; last year I saw this amazing German documentary there, totally unexpected but completely captivating!

unnormalised: Attending a festival is a fantastic way to broaden your cinematic horizons. You get to interact with filmmakers, attend Q&A sessions, and discuss films with fellow cinephiles. It's a completely different experience from watching a film at home, and it will definitely change the way you see movies.
